verses.text: Blessed is the one who dodges bad vibes, haters, and toxic crowds; they don’t roll with sinners or join the gossip squad.
Instead, they vibe fully with God’s word, meditating on it day and night.
They’re like a tree planted by streams of water—always nourished, always thriving, never dry.
Whatever they do? It pops off—they succeed in all their moves.
The wicked? Nah, they’re like chaff the wind blows away—no roots, no staying power.
God watches the path of the righteous, but the wicked? Their way crashes and burns.
Why are the nations wildin’ and plotting nonsense like they can outplay God?
Earth’s leaders link up, forming “Anti-God Alliance,” trying to go against the Lord and His chosen King.
They say, “Let’s break free from God’s rules; we don’t want His control.”
Meanwhile, God in heaven is literally laughing—He’s unbothered.
Then He speaks, and His words shake them—He shuts them down real quick.
“I already crowned My King on Zion, My holy hill.”
The King says, “Let me tell you what God said: ‘You are My Son; today I declare You Mine.’”
“Ask Me, and I’ll hand you the nations; the whole world is yours.”
“You’ll break rebellious nations like pottery smashed with an iron rod.”
So, kings—be smart. Leaders—take this seriously.
Serve the Lord with reverence; tremble but obey Him.
Honor the Son, or chaos will catch you slipping; His anger fires up fast. Blessed are the ones who take refuge in Him.
Lord, my ops are multiplying—whole crowd rising up against me.
They’re out here saying, “God ain’t saving him fr.”
But You, Lord, are my shield—my glow-up, the One who lifts my head back up.
I cried out to You, and You answered me straight from Your holy mountain.
I lay down, slept, and woke up again—’cause You kept me alive.
I won’t stress even if ten thousand mobs pull up against me.
Rise up, Lord! Save me! You’re the One who claps my enemies and breaks their power.
Salvation belongs to You, Lord—let Your blessing rest on Your people.
God of my righteousness, pick up my call—You’ve pulled me out of tight spaces before, so show me mercy again and hear me out.
Yo people, how long you gonna drag my name and chase lies like it’s a hobby?
Just know this: the Lord sets apart His people for Himself—when I call Him, He actually answers.
Chill out and stop wilding—think deeply on your actions when you’re quiet on your bed.
Offer the right sacrifices and put real trust in the Lord.
Everybody’s asking, “Who gonna bless us? Who gonna give us light?” Lord, shine Your face on us.
You’ve put more joy in my heart than people get when their bag is overflowing.
I can lie down and sleep in full peace—’cause You alone, Lord, lock in my safety.
Lord, hear me out — catch my words and peep my heart’s whispers.
My King and my God, You’re the One I pray to, so yeah, I’m calling on You.
Every morning I pull up with my prayers; I lay everything out and wait on You like refresh-loading.
You’re not a God who vibes with wickedness — evil can’t sit near You.
Arrogant people won’t survive in Your presence; You hate every move evil folks make.
You destroy liars; violent and deceitful people? The Lord detests them.
But me? I step into Your house by Your mercy — I bow down in awe toward Your holy temple.
Lord, lead me in Your righteousness because of my enemies; make Your path straight ahead of me.
Their words can’t be trusted — their insides are a whole disaster; their throats are like open graves, and their tongues just smooth-talk lies.
Rain judgment on them, O God — let their own schemes trap them. Kick them out for their many sins, ’cause they rebel against You.
But let everyone who trusts in You be hype and joyful — let them shout for joy forever, ‘cause You protect them.
For You, Lord, bless the righteous and cover them with favor like armor.
LORD, don’t stay angry; don’t punish me too hard.
Heal me, LORD; I’m weak, my bones ache.
My soul is in distress; how long will this last?
Turn, LORD, save me; show your mercy.
In death, no one remembers you; the grave can’t give thanks.
I’m full of tears; I weep all night.
My eyes are drained from constant crying.
Depart from me, all who do evil; the LORD heard my cries.
The LORD has heard my prayer; He accepts it.
Let all my enemies be ashamed and turned back.
LORD my God, I run to you; save me from my haters.
Save me or I’ll get shredded; don’t let my soul get wrecked.
LORD my God, if I did wrong, if there’s guilt in my hands—
If I returned evil for evil, or crushed my foes instead of mercy—
Let my enemy chase me, but never get the win; let justice hit them.
The LORD judges right; He’s furious with the wicked every day.
If they won’t repent, He sharpens His sword; readies His bow, armed and ready.
He’s ready; He’s plotting doom for the nations who stand against Him.
The LORD’s wrath reaches the wicked, He’s the ultimate defender.
My shield is God, who saves the pure of heart.
God is righteous; He loves right living; the upright can trust Him.
God’s eye sees everyone; the wicked can’t hide.
If they turn evil, He readies His sword; His bow is strung, arrows fly.
The wicked dig their own pit; they fall into the trap they made.
God’s wrath is real; it burns those who plot injustice.
The LORD is my shield; He saves the good, judges the wrong.
I’ll give thanks to the LORD for His righteousness; I’ll sing for the name of the LORD Most High.
LORD, your name is huge, way above earth and sky, your glory shows everywhere.
Babies and kids shut up your enemies, God, that’s wild.
When I look at the sky, your fingers made the moon and stars.
Humans? You even notice us? Crazy that you care.
You made us just below angels, crowned us with honor.
You gave us rule over your works, everything under our feet.
All the animals—sheep, oxen, and wild beasts.
Birds in the sky, fish in the sea, everything swimming its lane.
LORD, your name is massive, your glory is above all.
Lord, I’m giving you full praise — whole heart in. I’m talking about everything you’ve done.
I’m rejoicing in you; your name stays honored on my lips.
My enemies pull up, but they trip and fall because you back me.
You sit on the throne and judge right — my case is safe with you.
You call out the nations doing evil; you shut down the wicked and erase their name for good.
Their cities? Gone. Their plans? Finished. Memory deleted.
But you, Lord, stay forever; your throne stands solid in justice.
You judge the whole world with truth and rule the nations with fairness.
You’re a refuge for the oppressed — a safe spot in hard times.
Anyone who knows your name trusts you, because you never ignore the ones who seek you.
Sing to the Lord who rules from Zion; let the world know what He’s done.
He remembers the cries of the harmed; He doesn’t forget them.
Lord, be gracious to me. Look at the trouble I’m in from those who hate me — lift me from death’s edge.
I’ll praise you openly and rejoice in your rescue.
The nations fall into the traps they made; their own plans catch them.
The Lord shows Himself through righteous judgment; the wicked get caught in their own works.
The wicked head toward the grave — the same for nations that forget God.
But the needy aren’t forgotten; their hope won’t die out.
Rise up, Lord. Don’t let humans act like they run the world; let the nations face your justice.
Put them in place, Lord, so they finally learn they’re just human.
Lord, why do you feel far? Why hide when things get rough?
The wicked flex on the weak; let their own schemes hit them back.
The wicked brag on their desires and disrespect you.
Pride blinds them — they don’t seek you, and you’re not in their thoughts.
Their ways look smooth for now; your judgments seem far to them. They look down on others.
They think, “I’ll never fall; nothing bad will touch me.”
Their mouth stays full of cursing, lies, and trouble.
They hide waiting to ambush the helpless; they target the vulnerable.
They lurk like a lion in hiding, ready to drag the poor into their traps.
The helpless get crushed and fall under their pressure.
They think, “God forgot; He won’t notice.”
Rise up, Lord; lift your hand. Don’t forget the afflicted.
Why does the wicked think you won’t call them out?
But you *do* see it — the trouble, the grief — and you handle it. The weak trust you; you defend the fatherless.
Break the power of the wicked; expose every evil they’ve done.
The Lord is King forever; evil nations vanish from His land.
You hear the cries of the humble; you give them strength and listen closely.
You defend the fatherless and the oppressed, so people of the earth won’t keep terrifying others.
I take refuge in the Lord. So why you telling me, “Run to the mountains like a scared bird”?
Look — the wicked got their bow pulled back, aiming in the dark at people with clean hearts.
If the foundations break down, what can the righteous even do?
The Lord is in His holy temple; His throne is in heaven. He sees everything; His eyes test everyone.
The Lord checks the righteous, but He hates those who love violence.
He’ll rain fire and scorching wind on the wicked — that’s their portion.
Because the Lord is righteous; He loves righteousness. The upright will see His face.
Help, LORD — the faithful are disappearing; loyal ones are hard to find.
Everybody talks fake, smooth words, double-minded energy.
LORD, cut off the lying lips and the braggy tongues.
Those who say, “Our words run things; nobody can check us.”
“Because the poor are pressed and the needy cry out, I will rise,” says the LORD. “I’ll protect them.”
The LORD’s words are pure — like silver refined seven times.
You, LORD, will guard them; You’ll keep them safe forever.
The wicked roam everywhere when evil is praised.
LORD, how long will You forget me? How long will You hide Your face?
How long will I wrestle with myself and feel sorrow all day? How long will my enemy stay ahead?
Look at me, LORD my God; answer me. Give light to my eyes or I’ll fall.
My enemy will say, “I beat him,” and my foes will celebrate when I slip.
But I trust Your mercy; my heart rejoices in Your salvation.
I’ll praise You, LORD, because You’ve been good to me.
The fool says in his heart, “There’s no God.” People acting corrupted; nobody’s doing right.
The LORD looked down to see if anyone seeks Him.
All turned aside; all messed up. No one does good — not even one.
Do the evil ones not get it? They consume My people like bread and don’t call on the LORD.
They’ll shake with fear, because God stands with the righteous crew.
You shame the poor, but the LORD is their refuge.
Oh that salvation for Israel would come from Zion! When the LORD restores His people, let Jacob rejoice; let Israel be glad.
The fool says in his heart, “There’s no God.” People acting corrupted; nobody’s doing right.
The LORD looked down to see if anyone seeks Him.
All turned aside; all messed up. No one does good — not even one.
Do the evil ones not get it? They consume My people like bread and don’t call on the LORD.
They’ll shake with fear, because God stands with the righteous crew.
You shame the poor, but the LORD is their refuge.
Oh that salvation for Israel would come from Zion! When the LORD restores His people, let Jacob rejoice; let Israel be glad.
LORD, who may stay in your tabernacle? Who may dwell on your holy hill?
The one who walks right, does what’s true, and speaks truth from the heart.
Doesn’t slander, doesn’t harm others, doesn’t insult their neighbor.
Honors those who fear you; rejects what’s evil; keeps their word even when it hurts.
Doesn’t cheat people, doesn’t take bribes. This one stands firm and won’t be moved.
Keep me safe, O God; I run to you for refuge.
I said to the LORD, “You’re my Lord; every good thing I have comes from you.”
The people who follow you are the ones I delight in.
Those who chase other gods only multiply pain; I won’t join them or call on their names.
LORD, you’re my portion and my cup; you hold my future steady.
You placed me in good territory; the inheritance you gave me is solid.
I bless you for guiding me; even at night, you correct my thoughts.
I keep you before me always; because you’re at my right hand, I won’t be shaken.
My heart is glad, my soul rests, my body lives secure.
You won’t abandon me to the grave; you won’t let your holy one see decay.
You show me the path of life; in your presence is fullness of joy, and at your right hand are eternal pleasures.
Lord, hear me — my request is honest. My lips aren’t playing fake.
Let my verdict come straight from You; You see everything clearly.
You checked my heart, You watched me at night, You tested me — I’m not out here plotting wrong.
I’ve kept away from shady paths; Your words kept me steady.
Keep my steps firm on Your road so I don’t slip.
I call on You ’cause You always answer — listen to me, Lord.
Show me Your amazing love, the kind that saves those who trust in You.
Keep me as Your “eye-apple” — hide me under Your wings.
Protect me from the enemies hunting me down.
They’re heartless; their mouths talk big.
They surround me, watching every move.
They’re like a lion ready to pounce.
Rise up, Lord — stop them. Bring them down by Your hand.
Save me from people who live for this world only.
But me? I’ll see Your face in righteousness; when I wake, I’ll be satisfied with being like You.
God’s my rock, my shield, my ultimate backup.
My fortress, my safe spot, my stronghold.
I shout to Him, He always listens.
Trouble surrounds me, waves of chaos everywhere.
I call for help, He pulls through instantly.
Darkness tried to trap me, He lights the way.
The earth shook, mountains trembled—His power showed.
Skies flashed, storms shook, His presence is real.
The ground moved, hills wobbled, God’s wrath was clear.
He came fast, untouchable, swooping through.
Enemies attacked, arrows flew, He shielded me.
He trained my hands, gave me strength to fight.
Enemy defenses broke, I stood unshaken.
He leveled me up, gave me skill and courage.
I moved safely, path clear, fear gone.
My foes stumbled, couldn’t touch me.
They tried, they fell, justice served.
God kept me safe, my peace secure.
He punished the wicked, exposed their plans.
They were humbled, saw His hand.
My crown secure, His faithfulness unmatched.
He rewards the ones who walk true.
He guides my steps, keeps me aligned.
Strength from Him, I stand firm.
My path straight, no detours, no lies.
God matches my energy—pure and real.
He shields me, keeps me on track.
I shout, He backs me, full confidence.
Storms obey His name.
Ground steady, I move strong.
He’s my ultimate support, never fails.
Ready for battle, powered by Him.
He equips me with wisdom, skill, focus.
Barriers break, doors open by His hand.
Light guides me, no darkness blocks.
Enemies exposed, powerless.
Their plans collapse, they stumble.
I move sure, His strength in me.
Respect comes, His name honored.
I dodge traps, nothing sticks.
Life’s chaos? Handled, confidence solid.
He levels me up, keeps me strong.
Focused, precise, moving with skill.
Obstacles cleared, path ready.
My steps swift, foes fall behind.
Sure-footed, stable, grounded in Him.
God’s my MVP, always reliable.
Victory is His, I give Him praise.
His power eternal, mercy never ends.
Forever grateful, His love sustains me.
Look up—the sky’s showing off God’s epic power, clear for everyone to see.
Every day speaks His story, every night whispers His wisdom.
No words needed—the universe itself tells the truth.
His message travels everywhere, reaching everyone without fail.
The sun comes out like a champion on a mission, spreading warmth and energy.
It doesn’t miss a beat, lighting up the earth from corner to corner.
God’s law is perfect—guiding souls, giving life, leveling us up in the right way.
His rules are trustworthy, clear, and just—they make simple hearts wise.
Respecting God? Eternal power, lasting forever.
His commands are priceless, sweeter than honey, more valuable than gold.
Following them keeps you safe and wise; ignoring them is a trap.
Help me notice my mistakes, even the ones I can’t see.
Keep me from messing up badly—protect me from sin’s traps.
Let my words and thoughts honor You, God—my strength and my guide.
May the Lord notice you instantly in your bad days and may the God of Jacob pull up for you when life swings.
May He send you backup from His throne and may His strength hold you steady from Zion.
May He remember every sacrifice you’ve made and may He honor every offering you’ve placed before Him.
May He give you the exact desires He Himself shaped in your heart and help all your plans line up with His will.
We will celebrate when He comes through and lift His name like a banner after the victory. May the Lord fulfill every request that lines up with Him.
Now I know this for real: The Lord rescues His chosen one. He answers from heaven with power only He owns.
Some people trust systems and strength, but we trust the name of the Lord our God.
They trip and collapse, but we stay standing because He keeps us standing.
Lord, save us. And let the king You’ve placed hear us when we cry out.
Lord, the king celebrates Your strength, and he’s hyped because You give real victories.
You didn’t ignore what he wanted — You actually handed him the desires he prayed for.
You blessed him with goodness straight from You and placed a crown on his head — one that actually means something.
He asked for life, and You gave him long years that stretch beyond what he imagined.
Your victories made him shine, and You dressed him with honor and glory that only You can give.
You put him in blessings that don’t expire, and Your presence makes him overflow with joy.
Because the king trusts You, Your unfailing love keeps him steady and unshaken.
Your hand finds every enemy, Your right hand catches anyone standing against You.
You burn through opposition like fire, and Your presence wipes out wicked plans.
You remove their influence from earth, and their legacy fades — they won’t get to continue their damage.
They try to plan evil against You, but their schemes can’t survive Your power.
You make them turn back in fear because Your arrows hit what they aim at.
Lord, rise up in Your strength; we’ll praise You for the power You keep showing.
God… why do You feel far? I’m crying out but it’s like You’re silent.
Day and night I call, but it feels like no answer is landing.
But You’re still holy, and Your people praise You nonstop.
Our ancestors trusted You, and You came through for them.
They cried to You and got saved; they trusted, and You didn’t embarrass them.
But right now I feel small — like people see me as nothing.
Everyone watching mocks me, shaking their heads like they already know my story.
“Let his God save him,” they say — “since he claims God likes him.”
But You’re the One who brought me out safely from birth; You’ve been with me since day one.
From my first breath, You’ve been my God — I’ve always been dependent on You.
So don’t stay far — trouble is close and there’s no human help.
People surround me like strong bulls, trying to pressure me.
They open their mouths at me like lions ready to strike.
I feel like I’m melting inside; my strength is leaking away.
My energy is dried out, and my tongue sticks like I'm dehydrated. You’ve let me hit the ground.
Enemies surround me like wild dogs; they pierce my hands and feet.
I can see all my bones; people stare at me with zero mercy.
They divide my clothes and cast lots for what I’m wearing.
But Lord, don’t stay distant — You’re my strength, hurry to help me.
Save my life from the sword; save me from the danger right in front of me.
Rescue me from the lions’ mouths and the horns of wild animals.
I’ll tell my brothers about You; I’ll praise You in the assembly.
All who respect God — praise Him. Everyone connected to Jacob — honor Him.
God didn’t ignore the suffering one. He didn’t hide. He heard the cry.
My praise comes from You, and I’ll keep honoring You publicly.
The humble will eat and be filled; those who seek the Lord will live in joy.
The whole world will remember God and come back to worship Him.
Because the kingdom belongs to the Lord — He’s the One ruling every nation.
All people — strong and weak — will bow before Him.
Future generations will serve Him; they’ll hear about what He’s done.
They’ll pass down the story: “God did this. He finished it.”
The Lord is my Shepherd — I’m fully covered. I’m not lacking anything.
He settles me in calm places and leads me where my soul can breathe again.
He restores my whole vibe and guides me into the right path ’cause His name stays pure.
Even when I walk straight into dark seasons, I’m not shaking — ’cause You’re right there with me. Your protection keeps me stable.
You set a whole table for me right in front of the people betting on my downfall. You refresh me, and Your blessings stay overflowing.
Your goodness and mercy are basically stalking me for life — and I’m staying in Your house forever.
The earth and everything in it? Yeah, that’s all God’s — He runs the whole system.
He built it from the ground up, set it steady on the waters.
Who can step into God’s space? Who can stand where He is?
Only the one with clean hands and a clean heart — no idols, no fake vibes, no deceit.
That person gets blessing from the Lord and approval from the God who saves.
That’s the squad of people who seek Him — the ones who chase after His presence.
Lift up your heads, gates; open wide, ancient doors — the King of Glory is stepping in.
And who’s this King of Glory? The Lord — strong and unstoppable in battle.
Lift your heads again, gates; open up, ancient doors — the King of Glory is entering.
Who is this King of Glory? The Lord of hosts — yeah, that’s Him.
Lord, I lift my whole life to You — You’re the One I’m banking on.
I trust You fully; don’t let me get clowned or end up ashamed.
Anyone who waits on You won’t be disappointed — only the ones wilding out in rebellion get exposed.
Show me Your paths, Lord; teach me how You move.
Guide me in Your truth — You’re my God and my Savior; I’m waiting on You all day.
Remember Your mercy and love — they’ve been Your style since forever.
Don’t pull up my past mistakes or teen-level foolishness — look at me through Your mercy, ’cause You’re good.
God is solid and upright — that’s why He teaches sinners the right path.
He guides the humble step-by-step and shows them His way.
Every path He leads is full of love and truth for the ones keeping His covenant.
For Your name’s sake, forgive my mess — yeah, it’s a lot.
Whoever reveres the Lord? He gets shown the best route for his life.
He’ll live in goodness, and his children will inherit the land.
The Lord shares His secrets with those who fear Him — He lets them in on His covenant.
My eyes stay locked on Him ’cause He’s the One who pulls me out of traps.
Turn to me, Lord — I’m feeling lonely and stressed.
My problems are stacking — pull me out before they bury me.
Look at my pain and struggles and wipe out all my sins.
See how many enemies I’ve got and how they hate me for no reason.
Guard me and save me — I’m trusting You, don’t let me be ashamed.
Let integrity and uprightness protect me because my hope is in You.
Redeem Israel, God — step in for Your people.
Lord, check my case — I’ve walked straight. I’ve been trusting You without switching sides.
Run the diagnostics on my heart and mind — test me for real.
Your love stays in front of me, and I move according to Your truth.
I don’t link up with fakes, and I’m not vibing with shady people.
I literally can’t stand gatherings of wickedness — I’m not sitting at their table.
I keep my hands clean, and I come to Your altar ready.
So I can shout Your praise and talk about all the wild, awesome things You’ve done.
Lord, I love Your house — the space where Your presence pulls up.
Don’t count me in with the sinners, or lump me in with people who love violence.
Their hands stay full of evil schemes, and their right hands are loaded with bribes.
But me? I’m walking straight. Save me, show me grace, and keep me steady.
My feet are planted on solid ground — and in the whole assembly, I’m praising You loud.
